docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 30 -- The Gregory and Gearhart bills to make Blair House the temporary residence of the next Vice President until an official home can be built for him is likely to crash head-on with plans already afoot in Congress to make Blair...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 30 -- The Gregory and Gearhart bills to make Blair House the temporary residence of the next Vice President until an official home can be built for him is likely to crash head-on with plans already afoot in Congress to make Blair House the temporary home of the President until the White House can be fireproofed and propped up.
docs.abstract: plan for use of Blair House clashes with other uses

headline.main: CLASH PERILS HOME FOR VICE PRESIDENT; Using Blair House Temporarily Runs Into Needs Imposed by Repairs to White House

byline.original: By BESS FURMANSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, July 30 -- Men swimmers of the United States, paced by smooth-muscled Wally Ris of the University of Iowa, swept to a one, two, three clean-up in the 100-meter free-style semi-finals of the Olympics in Empire Pool today.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 30 -- Men swimmers of the United States, paced by smooth-muscled Wally Ris of the University of Iowa, swept to a one, two, three clean-up in the 100-meter free-style semi-finals of the Olympics in Empire Pool today.

headline.main: THREE AMERICANS BEAT JANY'S TIME; Ris Leads Free-Style Swim Qualifiers -- Harlan and Lee Pace Springboard Divers

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 31 -- A further step in the remodeling of Argentine education was achieved by President Peron yesterday, when the Deputies by a vote of 71 to 22 approved the general idea of his proposal to establish a national workers' university.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 31 -- A further step in the remodeling of Argentine education was achieved by President Peron yesterday, when the Deputies by a vote of 71 to 22 approved the general idea of his proposal to establish a national workers' university.
docs.abstract: Deputies group charges Buenos Aires elementary schools stress blind obedience to Pres Peron; Dr Rojas comments

headline.main: PERON'S UNIVERSITY VOTED BY DEPUTIES; But the Opposition Denounces Workers' School as Plan to Glorify President

byline.original: By MILTON BRACKERSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: If there was any significance in the trading in the foreign exchange market last week -- it was not in the turnover, which was light, nor in the quotations, which were well maintained -- it was in the growing confidence in the pound sterling as this...
docs.lead_paragraph: If there was any significance in the trading in the foreign exchange market last week -- it was not in the turnover, which was light, nor in the quotations, which were well maintained -- it was in the growing confidence in the pound sterling as this was reflected in the strong desire to buy in a market relatively light of supply.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended July 30, 1948

docs.snippet: LONDON, Aug. 1 -- With three gold medals won in the 100-meter, the 400 hurdles and the broad jump, the United States track and field team is favored to capture the pole vault tomorrow as competition is renewed in the games of the XIV Olympiad before...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Aug. 1 -- With three gold medals won in the 100-meter, the 400 hurdles and the broad jump, the United States track and field team is favored to capture the pole vault tomorrow as competition is renewed in the games of the XIV Olympiad before another sell-out crowd of 83,000 at Wembley Stadium.

headline.main: Americans Favored to Win Pole Vault as Olympic Competition Resumes Today; WHITFIELD FACES TEST IN 800 FINAL U.S. Track Ace Runs Against Strong Field Today -- Trials at 200 Meters Listed ZATOPEK SEEKS A DOUBLE Will Go After Second Victory in 5,000 -- Americans Strong in Discus, Pole Vault

byline.original: By ALLISON DANZIGSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: FLAME REACHES TORQUAY; Symbol Used in Ceremonies to Open Yachting Competition

docs.snippet: LONDON, Aug. 2 (AP) -- America's wizards of the court punctured any doubts of their Olympic basketball invincibility today by scoring a leisurely 53 to 28 triumph over Czechoslovakia, the best team in all Europe.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Aug. 2 (AP) -- America's wizards of the court punctured any doubts of their Olympic basketball invincibility today by scoring a leisurely 53 to 28 triumph over Czechoslovakia, the best team in all Europe.

headline.main: U.S. FIVE DEFEATS CZECH TEAM, 53-28; Americans Coast to Triumph Over Best Squad in Europe -- Canada Upset, 37-36

docs.snippet: LONDON, Aug. 2 -- Malvin G. Whitfield stepped up on the pedestal with the great Negro Olympians today as the United States won two more gold medals in track and field for a total of five thus far in the games of the XIV Olympiad.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Aug. 2 -- Malvin G. Whitfield stepped up on the pedestal with the great Negro Olympians today as the United States won two more gold medals in track and field for a total of five thus far in the games of the XIV Olympiad.

headline.main: U.S. Captures Two More Track and Field Titles as Three Olympic Marks Fall; WHITFIELD BREAKS 800-METER RECORD American's 1:49.2 Clips Time for Games -- Wint, Jamaica, 2d, Hansenne, France, 3d BELGIAN AND ITALIAN STAR Reiff Cuts 5,000 Figures and Consolini Sets Discus Mark -- Vault to Smith of U.S.
